title: Canberra .NET user group - September
eventShortDescription:
One of the best ways we can build trust with our customers and protect our organizations is through application security. This is especially important to Australia’s Federal and State Agencies as Cybercrime and Cyber Espionage risks increase.

Authentication is meant to verify identity. Traditional, single-factor password based authentication is no longer enough to protect our users and organizations. Although two-factor authentication (2FA) and verification (2FV) have been available to ASP.NET for some time, with Visual Studio 2013 Update 3 the MVC templates have been updated to support those authentication scenarios. In this talk we will explore the new Visual Studio templates, see how two factor authentication and verification works in both internet and enterprise contexts, and take a brief look ahead at the possibilities of multi-factor authentication.


About the presenter:
Richard Elberger is Director at RAE Consulting, Technical Trainer, Consultant, and Open Source maintainer. Prior to founding RAE Consulting in 2008, Mr. Elberger held management and technical leadership positions at Microsoft Corporation, System Management Arts, Inc., and EMC Corporation. Mr. Elberger holds an MBA from University of Massachusetts Amherst, Six Sigma Black Belt certification from Villanova University, and many technical certifications across a wide range of technologies.
